alert.note: Alert for Essex; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 7:33AM EST until January 17 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Little Falls affecting Passaic and Essex Counties. Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Passaic, Morris and Essex Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Passaic, Morris and Essex Counties. For the Passaic River...including Little Falls, Pine Brook, Singac... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Little Falls. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, The lower end of East-Holsman Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 6.0 feet, Portions of Hoffman Grove in Wayne sustain some nuisance flooding. At 6.5 feet, Low lying areas in the vicinity of Two Bridges in Wayne are flooded. The lower end of Bergen Street in Paterson, closest to the river, begins to flood. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding begins in Lincoln Park, Wayne and Little Falls. At 8.0 feet, Flooding occurs in the "Old" Wayne area of Wayne. The recycling center and Wagaraw Road ball field complex in Hawthorne begins to experience flooding. At 8.5 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in Fairfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Tuesday was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.6 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.6 feet on 03/24/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Passaic River Little Falls 7.0 7.7 Tue 7 am 6.7 5.9 Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 745 PM EST.
